sentences.en: Blind people recognise things by feeling them.
Fundamentals and overtones of other bands in this region are not difficult to recognise.
sentences.cn: 在这个区域中其他谱带的基振动或信频是不难识别的.

sentences.en: He must recognise by now that he will be a one-term, increasingly lame duck president.
sentences.cn: 他现在应该已经明白，自己这个总统一任就会下台，而且权力将越来越小。

sentences.en: Hence, some men never recognise the turning in the tide of their abilities.
sentences.cn: 因此, 有些人从未意识到自己能力的衰退.

sentences.en: I didn't recognise your voice on the phone.
sentences.cn: 在电话里我没听出你的声音.

sentences.en: I know I've put on a bit of weight, but don't you recognise me at all?
sentences.cn: 胖了一点, 不是这就不认得我了 吧 ?

sentences.en: If marriage is to succeed in the 1990's, then people have to recognise the new pressures it is facing.
sentences.cn: 在20世纪90年代人们要想婚姻美满，那就不得不认识到它所面临的新压力。

sentences.en: Most people recognise the need to pay a golden hello to attract the best.
sentences.cn: 大多数人都认识到需要用高额聘金来吸引精英人才。

sentences.en: Recognise me not, by word, by sign, by look!
sentences.cn: 无论从言谈间, 从表情上,还是从动作上,都要装作不认识我!

sentences.en: That she may be able to recognise the faces and know the persons.
sentences.cn: 让她来认认面孔,认认人.

sentences.en: The fusty old establishment refused to recognise the demand for popular music.
sentences.cn: 这一古板的老旧机构拒绝承认人们对流行音乐的需求。

sentences.en: The machine can recognise hand-written characters and turn them into printed text.
sentences.cn: 这种机器能够识别手写字体，并将其转化为打印文本。

sentences.en: They only recognise badness when they perceive it in others.
sentences.cn: 他们只看到别人身上的恶行。

sentences.en: They recognise the urgency of righting the economy.
sentences.cn: 他们认识到了复苏经济的紧迫性。

sentences.en: We recognise that education is not a consumer product.
sentences.cn: 我们认识到教育不是消费品.

words.tran_cn: 可辨认的；可认识的；可承认的
识别；承认，认出；重视；赞誉；公认
承认；认出；辨别（recognise的过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 认出，识别出某人[某事物]，承认…有效[属实]，认可，承认[认清]（某事物）
